intro: Saurauia raimondiana var. caxamarcensis, commonly known as the Caxamarca saurauia, is a species of flowering plant native to the Andean regions of South America. It belongs to the Ericaceae family, which includes heathers and blueberries, and is characterized by its evergreen shrub form. The plant typically features small, elliptical leaves with a glossy surface and produces clusters of white or pale pink flowers. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in cloud forests at elevations between 1,500 and 2,500 meters. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
